definition: British colonial administration of Hong Kong 1837-1941 and 1945-1997
Hong Kong, abbr. for 香港[Xiang1 gang3]/surname Gang
United Kingdom/British/England/English/abbr. for 英國|英国[Ying1 guo2]
seat of government/government repository (archive)/official residence/mansion/presidential palace/(honorific) Your home/prefecture (from Tang to Qing times)

sentences.english: Hong Kong had been carrying out this policy for nearly 20 years.
sentences.chinese: 港英政府不折不扣地將這一政策執行了近20年。

sentences.english: The nature and quality of British administration evolved over the years.
sentences.chinese: 港英政府的性質和特點多年以來在逐漸發展變化。

sentences.english: Often, this was the result of resistance to the British government.
sentences.chinese: 這往往是抵制港英政府的結果。

definition: governor of Hong Kong (during the period of British rule, 1841-1997)
